revised_title: Enhancing Copper Sheathing Protection in Ships through Electrical Combinations
tldr: Humphry Davy conducts experiments to determine the effectiveness of electrical combinations, specifically zinc, cast iron, and malleable iron, in protecting copper sheathing on ships from corrosion. He finds that cast iron is the most effective protector and that the deposition of alkaline substances on the copper surface can be prevented by controlling the electrical power of the copper.
